ucigame

Interface Sound


  • public interface Sound
    Sound object for the ucigame game. An Sound object can contain music, sound effects, or any kind of sound recording, of any length. Many file formats and recording formats exist. Ucigame (and Java without additional libraries) can only play sound files in certain uncompressed formats; the exact possibilities seem to vary from computer to computer. Generally WAV and AU files can be played, as well as MP3 files. Multiple sound files can be played at the same time.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void loop()
      Plays the sound continuously; when the end is reached it starts over.
      void play()
      Plays the sound once, from beginning to end.
      void stop()
      Stops the sound if it is currently playing (or looping).

        Plays the sound continuously; when the end is reached it starts over.

        Stops the sound if it is currently playing (or looping).
